div.p: Mountain pass on the border between the Voralberg and the Tyrol, situated on the watershed between the Rhine and Danube valleys. The pass links the Montafon Valley with the Paznaun Valley.

Situated to the north-west of the Schenkers' regular vacation spot, Galtür, the pass is mentioned several times in Schenker's diaries and letters, e.g.: "A few days ago we found ourselves, at our favorite pass (the Zeinis Pass leading into the Montafon Valley) – a mere hour-and-a-quarter to hour-and-a-half away –, transported into early Spring; snow as far as the eye could see, and where the sun had melted it the very first tiny flowers: crocuses, primroses, etc." (OJ 6/7, [5], July 9, 1923).
